content: *array socks are an easy everyday knit with a bit of texture to keep things interesting built on a simple 3×1 rib they fit well and feel great to wear with a dip stitch detail that looks special without adding complexity inspired by the long colourway changes in blue brick yarns 1 the stitch pattern is quick to memorize and works just as well in solid or variegated yarns letting the yarn do its thing available in both top-down and toe-up these are the kind of socks you can knit on autopilot and still end up with something that feels thoughtful and finished * * top down cuff down * toe up * photo tutorial on short row for toe up sock * video tutorial for dip array stitch * photo tutorial for dip array stitch * fully charted and written instructions for each size * works great with variegated striped and solid sock yarn **size** ---- small medium large **finished measurements** --------------------- foot circumference 7 7 8 8 5 inches/ 17 5 19 21 5 cm foot length adjustable choose a size with approximately 1 inch/ 2 5 cm of negative ease in the foot circumference **materials** --------- yarn the blue brick dyeworks - killarney sock/ sasquatch sock twins 80% superwash merino wool 25% nylon 2 x 200 yard skeins and 1 x 30 g contrast skein caribbean christmas colourway recommend needle size 1 set us #1 / 2 25 mm needles for knitting in the round notions wool needle for grafting stitch markers **gauge** ----- 32 sts/ 44 row = 4 inches/ 10 cm in stockinette **pattern notes** ------------- work from chart or written instructions according to your preference 1 https //shop thebluebrick ca/
